column1:
3.11.5.5	
Summary of evidence and recommendations for the disease management of bacterial prostatitis

In young sexually active patients both STIs and Enterobacterales have to be considered as aetiological 
agents.
In patients > 40 years antibiotic therapy with ciprofloxacin is superior to pivmecillinam.
A negative sexual risk history does not exclude STIs in sexually active men.
